description:
cmd/godoc: remove extra / in paths

If I click on links which should send you to source code (e.g. type, function, etc),
the link is to //src/... (instead of /src/...).
This causes a DNS resolution failure on the browser.

Quick fix is to remove the leading / from package.html
(since godoc.go src links automatically add a leading / as necessary).

Fixes issue 3193.

messages.text:
Thanks Russ.

I'd like to be credited and so that I can make future changes. 

I just filled out a CLA.

On 2012/03/05 18:30:54, rsc wrote:
> I do not see your name in our CONTRIBUTORS list,
> and I don't see that you've filled out a CLA either.
> If you'd like to be credited for this change (and to make
> future changes possible for us to accept),
> please complete a CLA as described at
> http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright
> 
> Otherwise, this CL is simple enough that I can just
> copy it in.
> 
> Let me know what you'd prefer.
> 
> Thanks.
> Russ

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/
I'll roll this into my own CL.  I'd like to fix this soon.

I do not see your name in our CONTRIBUTORS list,
and I don't see that you've filled out a CLA either.
If you'd like to be credited for this change (and to make
future changes possible for us to accept),
please complete a CLA as described at
http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright

Otherwise, this CL is simple enough that I can just
copy it in.

Let me know what you'd prefer.

Thanks.
Russ

Hi russ hi responded on codereview. I filled out a cla.
On Mar 5, 2012 3:23 PM, "Russ Cox" <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> I'll roll this into my own CL.  I'd like to fix this soon.
>

Codereview isn't delivering email it appears.
Will do.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=faadc270f4d8 ***

cmd/godoc: remove extra / in paths

If I click on links which should send you to source code (e.g. type, function, etc),
the link is to //src/... (instead of /src/...).
This causes a DNS resolution failure on the browser.

Quick fix is to remove the leading / from package.html
(since godoc.go src links automatically add a leading / as necessary).

Fixes issue 3193.

R=golang-dev, rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5730059

Committer: Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org>

subject: code review 5730059: cmd/godoc: remove extra / in paths
